gnu.crypto.sasl.srp
Class SRP

java.lang.Object
  gnu.crypto.sasl.srp.SRP
public final class SRP
extends java.lang.Object

A Factory class that returns SRP Singletons that know all SRP-related mathematical computations and protocol-related operations for both the client- and server-sides.

Version:
$Revision: 1.4 $

          Convenience method to return the result of digesting the designated input with a new instance of the SRP message digest algorithm.

          Used by the client-side in the SRP exchenage, this method generates a session key suitable for symmetric encryption of the exchange between the client and server after authentication is successfully concluded.

Method Detail

instance

public static SRP instance(java.lang.String mdName)
Returns an instance of this object that uses the designated message digest algorithm as its digest function.

Returns:
an instance of this object for the designated digest name.

getAlgorithm

public java.lang.String getAlgorithm()
Returns:
the message digest algorithm name used by this instance.

generateServerKeyPair

public java.security.KeyPair generateServerKeyPair(java.math.BigInteger N,
                                                   java.math.BigInteger g,
                                                   java.math.BigInteger v)
Generates the server-side private and public key-pair, given the shared public modulus n and the generator g.

Parameters:
N - the shared public modulus.
g - the field generator.
v - the user's verifier.
Returns:
a KeyPair that contains both the private (b) as well as the public (B) keys of the server in the SRP exchange.

generateClientKeyPair

public java.security.KeyPair generateClientKeyPair(java.math.BigInteger N,
                                                   java.math.BigInteger g,
                                                   java.math.BigInteger B,
                                                   java.math.BigInteger x)
Generates the client-side private and public key-pair, given the shared public modulus n and the generator g.

Parameters:
N - the shared public modulus.
g - the field generator.
B - the server's ephemeral public key.
x - the hash of the username and password.
Returns:
a KeyPair that contains both the private (a) as well as the public (A) keys of the client in the SRP exchange.

generateServerK

public byte[] generateServerK(java.security.KeyPair kp,
                              java.math.BigInteger A,
                              java.math.BigInteger v)
Used by the server-side in the SRP exchenage, this method generates a session key suitable for symmetric encryption of the exchange between the client and server after authentication is successfully concluded.

Parameters:
kp - the server's key-pair.
A - the client's public key.
v - the user's verifier.
Returns:
the session key K.

generateClientK

public byte[] generateClientK(java.security.KeyPair kp,
                              java.math.BigInteger B,
                              java.math.BigInteger x)
Used by the client-side in the SRP exchenage, this method generates a session key suitable for symmetric encryption of the exchange between the client and server after authentication is successfully concluded.

Parameters:
kp - the client's key-pair.
B - the server's public key.
x - the digest output of [salt || username || : || password].
Returns:
the session key K.

newDigest

public IMessageDigest newDigest()
Returns a new instance of the SRP message digest algorithm --which is SHA-160 by default, but could be anything else provided the proper conditions as specified in the SRP specifications.

Returns:
a new instance of the underlying SRP message digest algorithm.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the implementation of the message digest algorithm does not support cloning.

digest

public byte[] digest(byte[] src)
Convenience method to return the result of digesting the designated input with a new instance of the SRP message digest algorithm.

Parameters:
src - some bytes to digest.
Returns:
the bytes constituting the result of digesting the designated input with a new instance of the SRP message digest algorithm.

digest

public byte[] digest(java.lang.String src)
Convenience method to return the result of digesting the designated input with a new instance of the SRP message digest algorithm.

Parameters:
src - a String whose bytes (using the default platform encoding) are to be digested.
Returns:
the bytes constituting the result of digesting the designated input with a new instance of the SRP message digest algorithm.

xor

public byte[] xor(byte[] a,
                  byte[] b)
Convenience method to XOR N bytes from two arrays; N being the output size of the SRP message digest algorithm.

Parameters:
a - the first byte array.
b - the second one.
Returns:
N bytes which are the result of the XOR operations on the first N bytes from the designated arrays. N is the size of the SRP message digest algorithm; eg. 20 for SHA-160.

public byte[] userHash(java.lang.String U,
                       java.lang.String p)
